name: Titanium.App.iOS.UserActivity
summary: The UserActivity module is used to enable device Handoff and to create User Activities.

events.name: useractivitywillsave

deprecated.notes: Set the property needsSave to true everytime you update current activity state instead.

events.summary:
Fired if the activity context needs to be saved before being continued on another device.

To fire the event, set the UserActiviy object's needsSave property to true.

The receiver should update the activity with current activity state.

After the event is fired, iOS will reset the needsSave property to false.

properties.name: activityType
properties.summary: The activityType of the User Activity triggering the event.

properties.name: title
properties.summary: The title of the User Activity if defined.

properties.name: webpageURL
properties.summary: The webpageURL of the User Activity if defined.

properties.name: userInfo
properties.summary: Dictionary object containing the userInfo data of the User Activity.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: useractivitywascontinued
events.summary: Fired when the user activity was continued on another device.

properties.name: activityType
properties.summary: The activityType of the User Activity triggering the event.

properties.name: title
properties.summary: The title of the User Activity if defined.

properties.name: webpageURL
properties.summary: The webpageURL of the User Activity if defined.

properties.name: userInfo
properties.summary: Dictionary object containing the userInfo data of the User Activity.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: useractivitydeleted
events.summary: Fired when the user activity get deleted using the deleteAllSavedUserActivities or deleteSavedUserActivitiesForPersistentIdentifiers methods.

parameters.name: contentAttributeSet
parameters.summary: SearchableItemAttributeSet object that contains the set of properties you want to display for a searchable activity.

methods.name: becomeCurrent
methods.summary: Marks the activity as currently in use by the user.
methods.description: For example, you should mark the activity associated with the active window as current. A newly created activity is eligible for continuation on another device after the first time it becomes current.

methods.name: deleteAllSavedUserActivities
methods.summary: Deletes all user activities created by your app.
methods.description: The useractivitydeleted event is fired after deteting the user activities. Listen and wait for this event to fired to ensure that the system deletes the activities (or marks them for deletion).

methods.name: deleteSavedUserActivitiesForPersistentIdentifiers
methods.summary: Deletes user activities created by your app that have the specified persistent identifiers.
methods.description: The useractivitydeleted event is fired after deteting the user activities. Listen and wait for this event to fired to ensure that the system deletes the activities (or marks them for deletion).

parameters.name: persistentIdentifiers
parameters.summary: Array of persistent identifiers of user activity.

methods.name: invalidate
methods.summary: Invalidates an activity when it is no longer eligible for continuation.
methods.description: For example, when the window associated with an activity is closed, you should invalidate the activity. An invalid activity cannot become current.

methods.name: isSupported
methods.summary: Determines if user activities are supported (true) or not (false) by the device.

returns.summary: Returns true if the device supports user activity.

methods.name: resignCurrent
methods.summary: Marks the activity as currently not in use and ineligible to be continued.

properties.name: activityType
properties.summary: Name of the activity type.
properties.description:
Apple recommends using a reverse DNS scheme to name activities in the format: com...<activity_type>.

The activity type must also be registered in the ios plist section of the tiapp.xml file. Add the NSUserActivityTypes key and set its value to an array of activity type strings.

# tiapp.xml

<ti:app>
  <ios>
    <plist>
      <dict>
        <key>NSUserActivityTypes</key>
        <array>
          <string>com.fooinc.musicalpedia.playtrack</string>
        </array>
      </dict>
    </plist>
  </ios>
</ti:app>

properties.name: eligibleForHandoff
properties.summary: Set to true if this user activity should be eligible to be handed off to another device

properties.name: eligibleForPrediction
properties.summary: A Boolean value that determines whether Siri can suggest the user activity as a shortcut to the user.
properties.description: To donate a user activity to Siri Shortcuts, set eligibleForPrediction to true and make the user activity current. To make the user activity current, call the becomeCurrent method of activity. For more information, see https://developer.apple.com/documentation/sirikit/donating_shortcuts?language=objc.

properties.name: eligibleForPublicIndexing
properties.summary: Set to true if the user activity can be publicly accessed by all iOS users.
properties.description: Set to true if this user activity should be eligible for indexing for any user of the application, on any device, or false if the activity contains private or sensitive information or which would not be useful to other users if indexed. You must also set either the requiredUserActivityKeys or webpageURL property.

properties.name: eligibleForSearch
properties.summary: Set to true if the user activity should be added to the on-device index.

properties.name: expirationDate
properties.summary: Absolute date after which the activity is no longer eligible to be indexed or handed off.
properties.description: The date will be a string in the following format: "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'+0000'" For example, 2015-12-25T23:30:55.978+0000

properties.name: keywords
properties.summary: An array of string keywords representing words or phrases that might help the user to find the activity in the application history.

properties.name: needsSave
properties.summary: Set to true everytime you have updated the user activity and need the changes to be saved before handing it off to another device.

properties.name: persistentIdentifier
properties.summary: A value used to identify the user activity.
properties.description: Set this property to a unique value that identifies the user activity so you can later delete it with Ti.App.iOS.UserActivity.deleteSavedUserActivitiesForPersistentIdentifiers method.

properties.name: requiredUserInfoKeys
properties.summary: An array of String keys from the userInfo property which represent the minimal information about the user activity that should be stored for later restoration.

properties.name: supported
properties.summary: Determines if user activities are supported (true) or not (false) by the device.

properties.name: title
properties.summary: An optional, user-visible title for this activity such as a document name or web page title.

properties.name: userInfo
properties.summary: The userInfo dictionary contains application-specific state needed to continue an activity on another device.

properties.name: webpageURL
properties.summary: When no suitable application is installed on a resuming device and the webpageURL property is set, the user activity will instead be continued in a web browser by loading the specified URL.
properties.description: Only supports the http:// and https:// protocols. Any other protocol will throw an error.
